subject: Iran President Rouhani says ready and willing to hold talks if US sanctions are lifted and US returns to the 2015 nuclear deal
South Korea may delay cabinet reshuffle according to local press reports
Elders (ELD AT) to acquire Airr for AUD 10.85/Shr 50/50 cash and share deal

PRE-MARKET AUSTRALIA AND SOUTH KOREAN STOCK NEWS: AMP Capital (AMP AT) sale of AMP Life will not likely go ahead after being blocked by the RBNZ, Samsung Electronics (005930 KS) secures emergency supply of 3 materials; Japan is closed for Marine Day
content:
AUSTRALIA

AMP Capital (AMP AT) - Co. said sale of AMP Life will not likely go ahead after being blocked by the RBNZ, while the Co. has also scrapped its dividend. (AFR)

Coles (CGJ AT) - Co. is thought to be eying Harris Farm Markets as a potential acquisition. (Newswires)

Dexus (DXS AT) - Co. purchases building site in Sydney from Brookfield for AUD 190mln. (Newswires)

Elders (ELD AT) - Co. shares were halted ahead of statement regarding proposes acquisition. (Newswires)

Stockland (SGP AT) - Co. is expected to announce agreement to sell AUD 1.5bln retiring portfolio soon. (Newswires)

 

SOUTH KOREA

Samsung Electronics (005930 KS) - Co. reportedly secured emergency supplies of 3 materials impacted by the Japanese export curbs. (Newswires)

SK Telecom (017670 KS) - Analysts expect Co. sales during Q2 was not strong enough to slow decline in profit. (Newswires)

Other News - South Korea will reportedly increase minimum wage next year by 2.9% to KRW 8590 which would be the 3rd smallest minimum wage increase on record and a significant slowdown from the 10.9% growth this year. (Newswires)

 

 

JAPAN (Closed) Japan Display (6740 JT) - Co. is reportedly to spin off smartphone panels unit to raise funds. (Newswires)

Japan Post Insurance (7181 JT) - Co. will refrain from insurance sales until August after due to mis-selling policies. (Nikkei)

Yamato Holdings (9064 JT) - Co. is expected to post an oper. loss of around JPY 6.0bln vs. Prev. profit JPY 9.6bln Y/Y. (Newswires)

Polls - Polls show the ruling coalition are in the lead at 32.2% ahead of the Upper House elections on July 21st. (Newswires)

Other News - UN report shows Japan illegally exported military and luxury items to North Korea. (Newswires)

subject: US firms may get the go ahead to restart new sales to Huawei in the next 2-4 weeks, according to reports

Boeing (BA) 737 MAX could be grounded until January 2020, while it was also reported that American Airlines (AAL) extends cancellation of 115 daily flight for a 4th time to November amid Boeing 737 Max grounding
House Democrats said to circulate proposal to prevent large tech firms from functioning as a financial institution or issuing digital currencies
New Zealand Performance of Services Index (Jun)	52.7 (Prev. 53.6)
ASIAN DAILY ECONOMIC RELEASES CALENDAR NOW AVAILABLE IN THE RESEARCH SECTION: Highlights include Chinese GDP, Industrial Production and Retail Sales
UK PM candidate Boris Johnson will seek UK trade deal with US in first move if he becomes PM, according to Times
DAILY ASIA-PAC OPENING NEWS
content:
ASIA-PAC

US President Trump repeated that countries have been ripping US off for years and that tariffs are a great negotiating tool and revenue producer, while he also stated that the biggest parts of Mexico and China trade deals have not yet been revealed. Furthermore, Trump accused China of devaluing its currency, playing around with monetary policy and subsidizing its companies to lessen effect of tariffs, while he also repeated that tariffs are so far having little effect to consumers. (Newswires)

White House Trade Adviser Navarro said we are in a 'quiet period' regarding US-China talks. (Newswires)

Chinese Foreign Minister Yi urged the US 'not to play with fire' on the question of Taiwan, while it was also reported that China are to place sanctions on US firms involved in arms sales to Taiwan. (Newswires)

PBoC official said they will further reduce real interest rates for small firms and that China will take macro-prudential measures when necessary to keep CNY basically stable. (Newswires)

Huawei is said to plan deep job cuts in US as it struggles with the US blacklisting, while there were separate reports that US President Trump’s negotiators signalled that the next UK PM’s hopes of a post-Brexit trade deal with the US rest on his willingness to fall in line with tough American policies against Huawei. (Newswires/Telegraph)

China detained another Canadian citizen which is said to add to the high tensions between the two countries. (NYT)

Japan Industry Ministry officials said they briefed South Korea officials on the latest export control steps, while they added that curbs are not a countermeasure and South Korean Officials did not request their withdrawal. Japanese officials also stated that South Korea's trade control system is vulnerable and that Japan took enough time to answer questions from South Korea. (Newswires)

  • Chinese Trade Balance (CNY) Jun 345.18B vs. Exp. 278.50B (Prev. 279.12B). (Newswires)
  • Chinese Exports (CNY)(Jun) 6.1% vs. Exp. 6.9% (Prev. 7.7%)
  • Chinese Imports (CNY)(Jun) -0.4% vs. Exp. 3.7% (Prev. 2.5%)
  • Chinese Trade Balance (USD)(Jun) 50.98B vs. Exp. 44.65B (Prev. 41.66B). (Newswires)
  • Chinese Exports (USD)(Jun) Y/Y -1.3% vs. Exp. -2.0% (Prev. 1.1%)
  • Chinese Imports (USD)(Jun) Y/Y -7.3% vs. Exp. -4.5% (Prev. -8.5%)
  • Chinese New Yuan Loans (CNY)(Jun) 1660B vs. Exp. 1700.0B (Prev. 1180.0B). (Newswires)
  • Chinese Aggregate Financing (CNY)(Jun) 2260B vs. Exp. 1900.0B (Prev. 1400.0B)
  • Chinese Money Supply M2 (Jun) Y/Y 8.5% vs. Exp. 8.6% (Prev. 8.5%)

 

  • Indian Industrial Production (May) Y/Y 3.1% vs. Exp. 3.2% (Prev. 3.4%)
  • Indian CPI Inflation (Jun) Y/Y 3.18% vs. Exp. 3.2% (Prev. 3.05%)

 

UK/EU

ECB's Visco said further expansionary measures will be needed if the EZ economy does not pick up and that the ECB will continue assessing measures at their disposal in the coming weeks. (Newswires)

  • EU Industrial Production (May) M/M 0.9% vs. Exp. 0.2% (Prev. -0.5%, Rev. -0.4%). (Newswires)
  • EU Industrial Production (May) Y/Y -0.5% vs. Exp. -1.6% (Prev. -0.4%)

 

FX

Brazil's lower house of Congress may not vote on the pension reform bill until next month as tough negotiations over amendments delayed the process and reduced savings derived from the overhaul. (Newswires)

Fitch downgraded Turkey to 'BB-'; Outlook Negative. (Newswires)

 

COMMODITIES

BSEE said Gulf of Mexico crude output was cut by 70% on Friday and natural gas output was reduced by 56% due to storm preparations. (Newswires)

Iran Foreign Minister Zarif said Iran will continue with its oil exports no matter what the conditions. (Newswires)

 

GEOPOLITICS

South Korea official voiced uncertainty over US-North Korea talks this month and said the US appears to be waiting for a response from North Korea. (Yonhap)

Iran Cleric Sedighi said that Britain will be 'slapped in the face' for 'daring' to capture an Iranian oil tanker. In related news, Europe is set to delay Iran dispute decision despite pressure from US which has called on Europe to take a tougher stance against Tehran. (WSJ)

 

US

Fed's Evans (Voter, Dove) said he takes seriously that current rates may be more restrictive than they actually should be and that he does not see the timing of a rate cut as critical but sees a 50bps rate reduction as appropriate by the end of the year. Evans also commented that policy is currently around neutral but could be more accommodative if the aim is to lift inflation and that couple of rate cuts could lift inflation by 2021. Furthermore, he said the labour market seems quite vibrant and sees the US economy as having very solid fundamentals, although business investment is weaker than expected. (Newswires)

Fed's Barkin (Non-Voter, Hawk) said the fact that inflation is low is a victory not a defeat and that consumer spending is incredibly strong. (Newswires)

US President Trump will not impose uranium quotas despite assessment by the Commerce Department that US use of foreign uranium raises security concerns. (Newswires) 

 

MARKET RECAP

PC, as well as PC component makers, including Apple (AAPL), HP Inc (HPQ), Dell Technologies (DELL) and the semiconductor sector were supported by strong global PC shipment data from Gartner. Altria (MO) and Philip Morris (PM) moved higher on the news that a measure to overturn San Francisco’s recent ban on e cigarette sales has qualified for the November 2019 election. Facebook (FB) shares were under pressure after US President Trump spoke negatively on Libra and cryptocurrencies in general. Pharmaceutical and Biotech names were also under pressure on Friday, with Pfizer (PFE), Merck & Co. (MRK), Eli Lilly (LLY) and Amgen (AMGN) continuing losses after the Trump administration’s decision on Thursday to pull a bill that eliminates rebates from government drug plans. Compounding the sectors woes were medical instrument supplier Illumina (ILMN), which fell after the reporting abysmal revenue and revised down guidance, and Johnson and Johnson (JNJ), who sunk on reports it faces a criminal probe about what it knew about the cancer risks regarding baby talcum powder, though the company later denied the report. Anadarko (APC) shares rose on the news its stakeholders would vote on 8th August on the company's proposed USD 38bln sale to Occidental Petroleum (OXY), whose shares were also supported. Raytheon (RTN) shares were under pressure after China warned of sanctions on companies involved in the US’ USD 2bln arms sale to Taiwan. Spirit Airlines (SAVE) fell after the co. issued disappointing Q2 forecasts. Ford (F) jumped higher after Volkswagen injected USD 2.6bln into the co.’s self-driving unit. Snap Inc (SNAP) popped higher pre-market on an upgrade at Goldman Sachs. Milacron Holdings Corp (MCRN) caught a bit pre-market on the news the co.’s USD 2bln sale to Hillenbrand Inc (HI), who subsequently sunk. AB InBev (BUD) is now not pursuing Bud Asia IPO due to market conditions. Notable stocks benefitting from positive broker moves; Morgan Stanley (MS), Snap (SNAP) and GrubHub (GRUB) all upgraded at Goldman Sachs. S&P 500 +0.5% at 3014, NASDAQ-100 +0.6% at 7943, DOW +0.9% at 27331.

A lacklustre session saw Treasury yields come in by around a basis point or so. Fed speak (Evans, Kashkari, Brainard) was generally positive for the complex given the dovish rhetoric. The yield curve steepened slightly. Major curve spreads were mixed, but relatively unchanged. US T-note futures (U9) settled 4 ticks higher at 127-03+.

subject: NHC says Barry weakens to a tropical depression over northwestern Louisiana and that life-threatening flooding rains will continue into Monday
ASIA-PAC SERVICE IS NOW LIVE FOR TODAY'S SESSION
